title: How Phoenix rallied past No. 1 seed Minnesota in OT to win an instant classic
content: Phoenix overcame a 20-point deficit to stun Minnesota in overtime and knot their WNBA semifinal series.

title: Skubal, Tigers collapse, caught by Guardians
content: Ace Tarik Skubal fell apart on the mound in Cleveland on Tuesday night and Detroit lost its seventh straight game, allowing the Guardians to catch the Tigers in the standings and secure the tiebreaker.

title: AD: Gundy exit in best interest of OSU long term
content: Hours after Oklahoma State announced the firing of longtime football coach Mike Gundy amid a 1-2 start, athletic director Chad Weiberg emphasized the decision was made with the "best interest of moving the program forward in the long term."

title: Mets win thriller, retake control of last wild card
content: Playoff baseball is already here for the Mets, who rallied from a 6-1 deficit to defeat the Cubs 9-7 on Tuesday and leap back into the sixth slot in the NL playoff pecking order.

title: Mercury match WNBA history with Game 2 rally
content: The Phoenix Mercury posted an 89-83 overtime victory over the Minnesota Lynx at Target Center Tuesday night, tying the WNBA record for largest road comeback in the postseason, matching the Chicago's Sky's 20-point rally against the Atlanta Dream in 2014.

title: Aces heed call to get 'feisty,' tie series in blowout
content: After a disappointing Game 1, the Aces ramped up their intensity in a 22-point blowout of the Fever to even the series Tuesday night.

title: Surging Mariners secure one clinch, eye 'big one'
content: A come-from-behind victory over the Rockies on Tuesday night sent the Mariners back into the postseason and put them on the cusp of a long-awaited division title.

title: Parsons on sacking Dak: 'It's going to be painful'
content: Sacking Dak Prescott would be bittersweet for Micah Parsons, who told The Associated Press that sacking his former teammate and mentor is "going to be painful."

title: Caballero's walk-off seals Yanks' 60th playoff berth
content: José Caballero, acquired at the trade deadline to provide a versatile spark off the bench, swatted a two-out, walk-off single in the ninth inning Tuesday night against the White Sox to secure the Yankees their 60th postseason berth in franchise history.

title: 📈 NFL Power Rankings: Defensive issues
content: We stacked every NFL team ahead of Week 4. Who jumped up our 1-32 list? Plus, let's pick out the biggest defensive concerns for each roster.

title: Lions GM Brad Holmes wants to build a dynasty -- and a lasting legacy -- in Detroit
content: One of six Black GMs in the NFL, Holmes has helped inspire a franchise and a new generation of executives.

title: NFL Week 4 buzz: What we're hearing on Dart, Penix and early trade deadline talk
content: Here's the latest intel on the Giants starting Jaxson Dart, Michael Penix Jr.'s struggles in Atlanta and more.

title: 'Everybody's waiting for that moment': Ohtani gets set for his first two-way October
content: Whether he starts Game 1 on the mound or pitches in relief, Shohei Ohtani is primed to make even more history.

title: NBA Rank 2025 is here! Which players made the cut in Nos. 100 to 51
content: We're counting down the top 100 players in the league for the 2025-26 season. What players broke into Nos. 100 to 51?

title: NBA Rank: Which 10 players can make a jump into the top 100 next year?
content: ESPN analyst Kevin Pelton takes a look at which players could join the list next season after falling short this year.

title: Ranking every player in the 2025 Ryder Cup, from Scheffler to McIlroy to Højgaard
content: Team USA and Europe will meet at Bethpage Black for Ryder Cup bragging rights. We're breaking down every player competing in this year's tournament.

title: Jeff Passan's 2025 MLB regular-season awards
content: Forget the MVP and Cy Young Award races -- it's time for our fun and wide-ranging regular-season annual accolades.

title: Mike Gundy is out at Oklahoma State: Top candidates, transfers, recruits to watch
content: Gundy's long tenure in Stillwater is over. Who replaces the Pokes legend and who are the key players on the roster?

title: CFP Bubble Watch: A look at every Power 4 team
content: Putting the spotlight on select teams and questions around others as the early playoff picture takes shape.

title: Ovi breaks another Gretzky record? A draft lottery surprise? Bold predictions for every NHL team
content: With opening night approaching on Oct. 7, we take big swings on what will transpire for each team this season.

title: What's next for New York Liberty after firing Sandy Brondello?
content: Sandy Brondello seemingly had support from her players, but she's out after four seasons, including the 2024 WNBA title.

title: Isak's first Liverpool goal could be the start of something special
content: It may have been another disjointed display from Liverpool on Tuesday, but it was also another win. Add to that Alexander Isak's first goal for the club, and it's no wonder Arne Slot seems pleased.

title: Six fighters earn contracts on Week 7 of 'Dana White's Contender Series'
content: "Dana White's Contender Series" continues to prove it's a fruitful path to fighting in the UFC. Find out which fighters can earn a contract this week.

title: Early men's Bracketology: Houston stays No. 1, Virginia gives ACC hope
content: The new Cavaliers coach is tasked with winning as big as the coach he once beat in a historic upset. Can it be done in Year 1?

title: What Bruce Pearl's retirement means for Auburn, college basketball
content: The Tigers' winningest coach is retiring. Here's what that means with 42 days until the 2025-26 season.

title: Our NFL trade grades: Should Titans have gotten more for Jarvis Brownlee Jr.?
content: We're grading NFL deals leading into the Nov. 4 NFL trade deadline, including the Jets picking up Brownlee from Tennessee.

title: Pickups: Trey Benson next man up; Raiders' offense still has value
content: Highlighting available free agent options after yet another injury-filled weekend, as well as other helpful options ahead of Week 4.

title: Buzz: Jaxson Dart could revitalize Nabers, key Giants players' fantasy outlooks
content: Eric Moody on why Malik Nabers may be the biggest winner of the Giants' move to rookie QB Jaxson Dart.

title: Offseason survey: Best and worst moves, LeBron's future and Finals picks
content: League insiders share their picks for the Finals, most head-scratching moves of the summer and LeBron's next decision.

title: Jaylen Brown speaks at Bill Nye's Hollywood star dedication
content: The duo first connected in November 2024 after Brown expressed an interest on social media in meeting Nye.

title: Big questions: Have Lions' coordinators found their groove? How concerning is Cowboys' D?
content: NFL Nation reporters react to all the action, answering the biggest questions coming out of each game.

title: From designer clutches to grocery bags: Inside soccer's toiletry bag obsession
content: Toiletry bags are soccer players' fashion statements, and the stars of MLS opened theirs up and showed ESPN what's inside.

title: Why Dembélé's Ballon d'Or win over Yamal feels like the dawn of a new era
content: Ousmane Dembélé and Lamine Yamal, this year's top two in the Ballon d'Or voting, have a lot in common when it comes to how their energetic, attacking play is a welcome antidote in the tactics-driven world of modern soccer.

title: Men's divisional rankings: Liam Paro wins, enters welterweight rankings
content: Liam Paro cracks the top 10 in a new division following a decision win over David Papot. Here are the latest ESPN rankings in all weight classes.

title: Women's divisional rankings: Kaye Scott enters top 5 at 160 pounds
content: Kaye Scott makes her debut at middleweight, and Jelena Mrdjenovich enters the top 5 at junior featherweight.

title: Video: Kidnappers Spray Chilli Powder On Man's Face, Take Away His Child
content: A three-year-old boy was kidnapped in broad daylight from outside his home in Vellore district of Tamil Nadu on Tuesday, sparking panic in the locality.

title: Donald Trump's H-1B Visa Fees Hike Raises Doctor Shortage Concerns In US
content: The Trump administration's plan to dramatically raise fees for H-1B visas is drawing concern from US healthcare groups who say the move could worsen staffing shortages as more than half of healthcare workers consider changing jobs.

title: Renowned Kannada Novelist SL Bhyrappa Dies At 94
content: Popular Kannada novelist and philosopher S L Bhyrappa died due to cardiac arrest at a private hospital here on Wednesday.

title: Opinion: Opinion | Pakistan's Jihad Factories May Soon Be Getting A 'Saudi' Lifeline
content: For years, Riyadh has financially backed clerical groups and madrassas promoting the Salafi and Wahhabi schools of thought in Pakistan. If the new deal expands such patronage, it may solidify the framework on which the military-jihad complex relies.

title: On Camera, Headmaster Pulls Out His Belt, Attacks Education Officer In UP
content: A video has gone viral showing the headmaster of a school in Uttar Pradesh pulling out his belt and attacking an education officer after an argument over a complaint against him by a woman teacher.

title: No Response From India Bloc Yet, Asaduddin Owaisi Begins Solo Bihar Campaign
content: AIMIM president Asaduddin Owaisi kickstarted his campaign for the Bihar assembly elections in the state's Seemanchal region, on his own, amid no clarity over his party's tie-up with the Indian National Developmental Inclusive Alliance.

title: 17 Women Accuse Delhi Baba Of Molestation, His Car Has Fake Embassy Plates
content: The director of a well-known ashram in Delhi's Vasant Kunj area has been accused of sexual harassment by over a dozen students, said police.

title: UP Folk Singer, Husband Arrested Over 'Indecent Song' On Goddess Durga
content: Folk singer Saroj Sargam was arrested here along with her husband for allegedly uploading a song containing derogatory remarks against Goddess Durga on her YouTube channel, a police official said on Wednesday.

title: Google's AI Comeback: A Year After Bard, Gemini Shines
content: Caught off guard by ChatGPT and mocked for early blunders with its own generative artificial intelligence efforts, Google has pulled off a dramatic turnaround in just one year, becoming a major player in consumer-facing AI.

title: Clashes, Stone Pelting In Ladakh By Statehood Protesters, Police Van Burnt
content: Angry protesters clashed with the police in Leh city of Ladakh this morning, pelting stones at officials and even burning down a police vehicle, in the first such instance of violence during the ongoing statehood movement.

title: Once Nitish Kumar's Trump Card, This Group Is Now Rahul Gandhi's Bihar Bet
content: In the politics of Bihar, caste is both compass and trap: it orients every voter, every party, every pledge, even as it binds them to inherited hierarchies

title: Trapped In Gaza, Injured Mother 'Wishes To Die Together With Daughters'
content: Explosions shake the walls of the dim basement in Gaza City where Noor Abu Hassira and her three daughters are sheltering. They can't see much through a small, raised window.

title: Laughing Emoji On Grandfather's Death Post, Then A 20-Year-Old's Murder
content: A 20-year-old was stabbed to death during a physical altercation over a Facebook post in Gujarat's Rajkot. The victim, identified as Prince, was admitted to the hospital, where his condition deteriorated.

title: Global Cancer Deaths Likely To Exceed 18 Million By 2050: Report
content: Global cancer deaths are expected to exceed 18 million by 2050, according to the National Cancer Institute.

title: Woman Alleges Moral Policing By Coimbatore Flower Vendors Over Sleeveless Top
content: A woman in Coimbatore has alleged that she was subjected to moral policing by flower vendors at a local market after being criticised for wearing a sleeveless outfit.

title: Charlie Kirk Misquoted After Assassination. Here's What He Actually Said
content: Nearly two weeks after right-wing commentator and activist Charlie Kirk was assassinated in Orem, Utah, he has been widely misquoted and his views misrepresented on social media.

title: Jimmy Kimmel's Fiery Attack On Trump Over 'Bullying' As Show Returns To Air
content: TV show host Jimmy Kimmel on Tuesday launched a fiery attack on US President Donald Trump over the administration's alleged "bullying" and efforts to curb free speech.

title: 3 Separate Elections For 4 Rajya Sabha Seats In J&K, 1 In Punjab
content: The Election Commission of India (ECI) has announced the long-awaited Rajya Sabha elections in Jammu and Kashmir, nearly four years after four seats in the Upper House fell vacant.

title: Fact Check: Donald Trump's Tylenol And Autism Claims Don't Match Science
content: President Donald Trump announced Monday that his administration is strongly recommending that women limit Tylenol use during pregnancy unless medically necessary. But his comments came under intense criticism from medical experts and researchers

title: Exclusive: Indian Techie On How She Spent $2,000 To Beat H-1B Deadline
content: Amrutha Tamanam was in India last week on paid leave when her boss in the US messaged her about President Donald Trump's new diktat of $100,000 H-1B visa fee.

title: WNBA playoff schedule: Fever, Lynx take 1-0 leads in semifinals
content: The 2025 WNBA semifinals are underway, and Phoenix beat Minnesota in OT in an instant classic Tuesday.

title: Betting buzz: Mendoza, Beck, Moore top three Heisman favorites after Mateer injury
content: Following the news of John Mateer's hand injury, Indiana QB Fernando Mendoza is the new Heisman favorite.

title: College football betting: Is it time to buy into Fernando Mendoza and the Hoosiers?
content: As the odds shift for the Heisman Trophy and national championship, Pamela Maldonado explains how to bet.

title: Transfer rumors, news: Saudi clubs still insistent on Fernandes
content: Saudi Pro League clubs are reportedly linked to a move for Manchester United midfielder Bruno Fernandes. Transfer Talk has the latest news and rumors.

title: Should you draft Cooper Flagg in the third round?
content: Our experts weigh in on the No. 1 pick of the 2025 NBA draft and what type of fantasy production they expect out of him as a rookie.

title: Fantasy basketball: Sleepers, breakouts and busts for 2025-26
content: Which fantasy basketball players are going to exceed expectations in 2025-26? Our experts list their picks.

title: Sleepers and busts: Who to draft and who to avoid at current value
content: Here are the best fantasy hockey sleeper picks to draft, as well as which players to avoid at current rankings.

title: Plant my flag list: Greg Wyshynski's 10 must-draft players
content: Greg Wyshynski reveals the 10 players he's queuing up in every one of his fantasy hockey drafts this season.

title: Bihar SIR, PM Modi's 'huglomacy', Gaza: CWC resolution adopted at Patna meet
content: The Congress Working Committee convened in Patna, criticizing the Centre's foreign policy, asserting that Prime Minister Modi's 'huglomacy' has backfired, leading to India's diplomatic isolation and failure to protect national interests. The party addressed assembly election strategies and accused the BJP of "vote chori.

title: Tracing Swami Chaitanyananda: Who is director accused of molesting 15 Delhi students
content: Chinmayanad Saraswati, manager of an engineering institute in Delhi, is accused of sexually harassing multiple female students. Authorities estimate around 12 to 15 students may have been harassed. Police investigations revealed abusive language, obscene messages, and unwanted physical contact. Saraswati is absconding, and the Sri Sharada Peetham has severed ties with him.

title: Super Typhoon Ragasa: At least 17 dead after Taiwan barrier lake bursts
content: Super Typhoon Ragasa triggered the bursting of a barrier lake in Taiwan's Hualien County, resulting in at least 14 fatalities and 18 injuries. Rescue teams are actively searching for approximately 30 missing individuals after the floodwaters washed away a bridge and inundated a nearby town. Over 7,600 people were evacuated across Taiwan due to the typhoon's impact.

title: World’s 2nd richest to donate 95% of wealth to give on his own terms
content: Oracle's founder, Larry Ellison, now the world's second richest person with a $373 billion net worth, plans to donate 95% of his wealth. Moving away from traditional charities, Ellison is focusing his philanthropic efforts through the Ellison Institute of Technology (EIT) at Oxford, addressing global issues like healthcare and climate change.

title: IRCTC corruption case: Court to pronounce charge order; Lalu & family directed to appear
content: The Rouse Avenue Court will announce on October 13 whether charges will be framed against Lalu Prasad Yadav, his family, and others in the IRCTC hotel corruption case. Allegations involve irregularities in awarding maintenance contracts for IRCTC hotels during Yadav's tenure as railway minister. The CBI claims Yadav received land in exchange, while his counsel argues the tenders were fairly awarded and seeks discharge.

title: Pilots’ body seeks judicial probe into Air India AI171 crash
content: The Federation of Indian Pilots (FIP) has urged the government to launch a judicial inquiry into the Air India Flight AI 171 crash, citing concerns about bias and leaks within the Aircraft Accident Investigation Bureau's (AAIB) ongoing probe. FIP alleges the AAIB prematurely blamed the pilots and violated investigation protocols, potentially jeopardizing the integrity of the findings.

title: India-US trade deal: Goyal in America; ‘talks happening at different levels’
content: India and the US are engaged in ongoing trade discussions, with Minister Piyush Goyal currently in the US alongside key officials. These talks follow recent meetings in New Delhi regarding a proposed bilateral trade agreement, aiming for a swift and advantageous conclusion.

title: Jeff Bezos’ father hunts CEO: Family fortune at stake; multi-billion job open
content: Mike Bezos, father of Amazon's Jeff Bezos, is seeking a CEO for his family office, Aurora Borealis, amidst growing wealth complexities. Based in Miami, Aurora Borealis manages investments, philanthropy, and estate planning. This move signals a shift towards a more institutional structure, mirroring practices of other billionaire families.

title: 'BJP has mentally retired Nitish': Kharge says NDA's internal conflict out in open; targets PM Modi
content: Congress president Mallikarjun Kharge asserted that BJP now views Bihar CM Nitish Kumar as a burden before assembly polls, highlighting internal NDA conflict. He emphasized Bihar's demand for a caste census, noting that 80% of the population belongs to OBC, EBC, and SC/ST communities. BJP criticized the INDIA bloc, suggesting discord over seat-sharing and diminishing Tejashwi Yadav's CM prospects.

title: 'I feel bad for Pak players': Ex-India pacer's scathing attack
content: Ishant Sharma expressed sympathy for the current Pakistan cricket team, acknowledging the immense pressure they face from fans. He contrasted their situation with the era of Pakistani cricket legends and emphasized India's superior talent pool, infrastructure, and exposure. Sharma highlighted the mental burden on Pakistani players during India-Pakistan matches, noting the constant scrutiny from their supporters.

title: US H-1B $100K fees: Netflix founder says it will end lotteries
content: Netflix co-founder Reed Hastings supports Donald Trump's new $100,000 H-1B visa fee, a move that contrasts with the widespread criticism from Silicon Valley leaders. While Hastings believes the fee will ensure H-1B visas are reserved for high-value jobs, the White House clarified it's a one-time payment for new petitions only, causing confusion and concern among tech companies, especially startups.

title: Air India crash: Pilots’ body writes to MoCA seeking judicial probe
content: The Federation of Indian Pilots (FIP) has requested a judicial probe into the Air India Flight AI 171 crash, alleging a compromised investigation. In a letter to the Civil Aviation Minister, FIP accused the Aircraft Accident Investigation Bureau (AAIB) of bias and leaking protected cockpit voice recordings, leading to the character assassination of the pilot.

title: IND vs PAK: One-sided! Irfan recalls 18-yo moment to back 'no rivalry' claim
content: On the anniversary of India's 2007 T20 World Cup victory, Irfan Pathan subtly highlighted India's dominance over Pakistan in the format since that historic win. Yuvraj Singh and Robin Uthappa also shared their fond memories of the tournament. Suryakumar Yadav recently downplayed the India-Pakistan rivalry, citing India's superior T20I record.

title: H-1B rejected, O-1 approved: Bengaluru techie gets rare ‘Einstein Visa’
content: Tanush Sharanarthi's journey inspires many tech professionals. He secured the O-1 visa after H-1B rejections. The O-1 visa recognizes extraordinary ability. Sharanarthi's achievements and guidance helped him. His educational background also played a key role. Persistence and strategic focus are key. The O-1 visa demonstrates merit outweighs randomness. His story underscores skill, dedication, and understanding opportunities.

title: TN Class 10 row: Ettappa Maharaja's ‘false’ portrayal; Chaitanya Raja protests
content: Chaitanya Raja, the 42nd titular king of Ettayapuram Samasthanam, led a protest in Thoothukudi demanding removal of ‘false’ portrayals of Ettappa Maharaja in Tamil Nadu Class 10 history textbooks. He cited archival records to counter cinematic distortions and urged fact-based history. Supported by locals and political leaders, the protest sparks wider debate on historical accuracy in education.

title: Ladakh: Massive protest in Leh turns violent amid statehood demand; BJP office, police van set ablaze
content: Protests erupted in Leh, Ladakh, with demonstrators clashing with police and setting a police vehicle on fire. The unrest, spurred by the Leh Apex Body's youth wing, supports environmentalist Sonam Wangchuk's hunger strike. Wangchuk is advocating for statehood and Sixth Schedule status for the Union Territory, amidst stalled talks with the Home Ministry.

title: Health risk: Harvard study links deaths to private equity hospital takeovers; cautions India
content: A Harvard Medical School study reveals increased patient death rates in US hospitals acquired by private equity firms due to staffing and salary cuts, particularly in emergency departments and ICUs. Similar studies highlight concerns about quality of care, adverse events, and financial motivations behind these acquisitions, suggesting that healthier hospitals are targeted for cost-cutting measures.

title: 'Shaheen Afridi jaan de dega': Pakistan star on possible IND vs PAK final
content: Shaheen Shah Afridi responded to criticism about his performance in India-Pakistan matches, asserting his commitment to the team. He addressed concerns about aggressive behavior from Pakistani players, clarifying it's not a planned strategy but a natural part of their game.

title: IAF's iconic MiG-21 jets to bow out on September 26
content: After six decades of service, the Indian Air Force is set to retire its iconic MiG-21 fighter jets on September 26. The decommissioning ceremony and flypast will occur at Chandigarh Air Force Station, where the aircraft was first inducted in 1963.

title: ‘Atmanirbhar Bharat’: Cabinet approves Rs 69,725 cr for shipbuilding & maritime sector
content: The Union Cabinet, led by Prime Minister Narendra Modi, has approved reforms worth Rs 69,725 crore for the shipbuilding and maritime sector. These reforms encompass financial assistance, a maritime development fund, and a shipbuilding development scheme.

title: $100,000 visa fee: Blessing in disguise for laid off H-1B tech workers?
content: A recent hike in H-1B visa fees, reaching $100,000 for new applicants, may paradoxically benefit laid-off tech workers. This increase could incentivize companies to hire H-1B holders already in the U.S., offering a cost-effective alternative to sponsoring new visas.

title: SL Bhyrappa dies at 94: Padma awardee Kannada novelist; PM Modi mourns loss
content: Kannada novelist SL Bhyrappa passed away in Bengaluru due to cardiac arrest. He was 94. Bhyrappa was admitted to Rashtrotthana Hospital. Santeshivara Lingannaiah Bhyrappa was a renowned philosopher and screenwriter. He was born in Hassan, Karnataka. Bheemakaya was his first novel. He authored around 25 novels. Bhyrappa also served as a professor at NCERT, Delhi.

title: 'Dekh lenge': Afridi's warning to Surya ahead of potential India vs Pak final
content: The Asia Cup 2025 could potentially witness a historic India vs Pakistan final, a first in the tournament's history. After India's victory in the Super Four stage, Pakistan kept their hopes alive by defeating Sri Lanka. Shaheen Shah Afridi expressed his team's readiness for a potential final clash, emphasizing their determination to win the Asia Cup.

title: Mumbai: Blaze guts Kandivali chawl, 7 critical; Kurla fire damages hutments
content: A fire erupted in a Kandivali East chawl due to a suspected LPG leak, severely injuring seven residents, some with extensive burns. The blaze, which occurred opposite ESIC Hospital, was quickly extinguished. Separately, a smaller fire broke out in Kurla West, affecting several hutments, but no injuries were reported in that incident.

title: Who is Laila Faisal? Abhishek Sharma’s rumoured girlfriend; look at past relationship
content: Indian cricketer Abhishek Sharma is rumoured to be dating Laila Faisal, the co-founder of LRF Designs, a high-end clothing label. Laila has been spotted cheering for Abhishek at matches and is known for her family's business background and education in fashion.

title: Pakistan: Jaffar Express attacked in Balochistan; second blasts in 10 hours
content: A bombing on the Quetta-bound Jaffar Express in Pakistan's Balochistan province injured at least 12 people, including women and children, marking the latest in a series of attacks on the train since March. The blast, which occurred in the Spizend area of Mastung district, caused six carriages to derail and one to overturn.

title: Abhishek Sharma in contention for ODIs, likely to get a call-up for Australia
content: Abhishek Sharma’s explosive Asia Cup run could earn him a ODI call-up, as early as the Australia tour starting October 19. With 173 runs at a staggering strike rate of 208.43, the 25-year-old’s rise puts pressure on India’s established order.

title: Ragging horror in Tamil Nadu: ITI student stripped, hit with slipper
content: In Madurai, three minor boys were booked for ragging a 15-year-old ITI student inside a government hostel. The victim was stripped, humiliated, and beaten, with the assault recorded and circulated online, sparking outrage. Police have arrested the accused, and the hostel warden has been suspended.

title: 'Don't give a drop of water to Pakistan': Rajasthan farmers urge PM Modi
content: Farm associations in Rajasthan's north-western districts have appealed to Prime Minister Modi to halt water flow to Pakistan. They allege that Punjab diverted surplus water to Pakistan between July and September, despite facing shortages in its own canals. This action, according to the associations, threatens farming across 45 lakh acres in Rajasthan, particularly in Sriganganagar and Hanumangarh.

title: 'Come to my room': Swami Chaitanyanand sleazy WhatsApp chats to students
content: Swami Chaitanyananda Saraswati, director of an institute in Vasant Kunj, faces a police case after over 15 students alleged sexual harassment. He sent inappropriate messages, made coercive promises, and issued threats. Police have accessed WhatsApp chats, recorded student statements, and seized a luxury car with a fake UN plate.

title: '50 meters deep': Video shows massive sinkhole in Bangkok swallowing cars, poles
content: A road in Bangkok collapsed on Wednesday, creating a 50-meter sinkhole due to ongoing underground construction. The collapse, captured on video, swallowed a car and an electric pole. Bangkok's governor, Chadchart Sittipunt, attributed the incident to soil flowing into the tunnel, causing the road surface to give way, raising concerns about the city's infrastructure projects.

title: When 2 Punjab brothers hid in plane landing gear; one lived to tell the tale
content: A 13-year-old Afghan boy triggered a security alert at Delhi Airport after stowing away in the landing gear of a Kam Air flight from Kabul. Discovered upon arrival, he had journeyed without a ticket. The incident echoes a tragic 1996 event where two brothers attempted a similar feat, resulting in one brother's death from hypothermia during a flight to London.

title: Vaibhav Sooryavanshi hits six sixes, marks another Youth ODIs milestone
content: Vaibhav Sooryavanshi, the Indian teenage cricket prodigy, has shattered Unmukt Chand's record for the most sixes in Youth ODI history, reaching 41 sixes in just 10 innings. The 14-year-old's achievement came during a match against Australia U-19 in Brisbane.

title: Paracetamol-autism link? Mumbai doctors call data weak after Trump warns pregnant women
content: Amidst concerns in the US regarding a potential link between paracetamol use during pregnancy and autism in children, President Trump cautioned against its use. However, experts emphasize that the data supporting this link is weak and oversimplified, with other factors like genetics and fever potentially contributing more significantly.

title: 'AIMIM ready for alliance with RJD': Owaisi demands 6 Bihar seats
content: Asaduddin Owaisi's AIMIM has offered an alliance to Tejashwi Yadav's RJD ahead of the Bihar Assembly elections, formally requesting inclusion in the Mahagathbandhan. Owaisi, during his 'Seemanchal Nyay Yatra,' emphasized AIMIM's demand for six seats, warning of potential consequences if their proposal is rejected.

title: 'People only see medals, not grind': Athletes fired up for first WPAC at home
content: India is set to host the 2025 World Para Athletics Championships in New Delhi, showcasing its largest-ever contingent of 73 athletes. Fresh from their success at the Paris Paralympics and Kobe Worlds, Indian para-athletes like Simran Sharma, Navdeep Singh, and flagbearer Preethi Pal are ready to compete on home soil.

title: 'Didn’t want to be doctor': Maharashtra teen with NEET rank 1475th dies by suicide
content: Anurag Anil Borkar, a 19-year-old NEET qualifier from Maharashtra, tragically ended his life, revealing in a suicide note his lack of interest in pursuing a medical career. Despite securing a good rank and preparing for MBBS in Gorakhpur, he expressed a desire to enter the business field. Police are currently investigating the circumstances surrounding his death.

title: From molestation to fraud: Old cases against Delhi institute director resurface
content: Chinmayanad Saraswati, director of a Delhi engineering institute, faces renewed sexual harassment allegations from students. Accused of harassing 12-15 students with abusive messages and unwanted contact, Saraswati is currently absconding. Police are reviewing past complaints from 2009 and 2016. Investigations revealed a luxury car with a forged UN number plate. Sri Sharada Peetham has disavowed Saraswati, condemning his actions.

title: Shawls, sculptures and more: Gifts received by PM Modi up for auction
content: Prime Minister Narendra Modi has encouraged citizens to participate in the 7th edition of the PM's Mementoes E-Auction, featuring gifts received during official events. The auction, running from September 17 to October 2, 2025, offers over 1,300 items, including art, sculptures, and sports memorabilia. Proceeds will support the Namami Gange Project, dedicated to cleaning and conserving the Ganga River.

title: Sensex at 94,000 by 2026-end? HSBC upgrades India to ‘Overweight’
content: HSBC has upgraded India's equities rating to 'Overweight', projecting a Sensex target of 94,000 by 2026, indicating a 13% potential increase. This decision is driven by appealing valuations, supportive government policies, and consistent domestic investor engagement.

title: L&T, BEL join hands for India's 5th-generation fighter aircraft programme
content: a career spanning nearly 18 years, he has reported from multiple datelines . he is based out of Bengaluru, India’s science capital that hosts the ISRO HQ . read more Vicky Kuashal - Katrina Kaif: Must see pics of soon-to-be parents 10 best family dog breeds .

title: 'Don't want more trouble': Sonam Wangchuk calls off 15-day hunger strike as protest turns violent
content: the TOI News Desk comprises a dedicated and tireless team of journalists who operate around the clock to deliver the most current and comprehensive news and updates to the readers of The Times of India worldwide . the team is at the forefront of gathering, verifying, and presenting breaking news, in-depth analysis, and insightful reports on a wide range of topics .

title: Futures of Giants' Brian Daboll, Joe Schoen hinge on Jaxson Dart's instant success
content: the new york Giants will start rookie quarterback Jaxson Dart in week 4 . the decision came down after coach Brian Daboll left the door open to a change on Monday . he will start until the Giants couldn't justify him being the starter .

title: Ten years of Kirby Smart at Georgia
content: a stranger approached a football coach to share a story about her daughter . she stepped outside to hear smart screaming at his players through a microphone during practice . the woman said she felt so much better that she wasn't in football practice, she said .

title: Micah Parsons isn't the first player Jerry Jones talked contracts with -- he won't be last
content: it has been a common practice for Jones and executive vice president Stephen Jones over the years to engage with their star players in hopes of convincing them to sign a new deal . there is nothing in the collective bargaining agreement that explicitly prevents the discussions . several agents said it is not a good look to circumvent them and go to the player who might not know all the details .

title: Barnwell: Ranking Week 3's most infuriating losses, starting with the Packers' massive upset
content: a few teams went home feeling as if they were robbed or threw away a game in which they were the better team . the four most agonizing losses of week 3 hit another level . let's pick the most enraging defeats of the week .

title: No, Indiana football hasn't really beaten anyone, but what if it's for real?
content: Indiana dropped 35 first-half points against a top-10 opponent previously hyped for its defense . a 63-10 annihilation of the no. 9-ranked Illini, a prime-tieti-ranked, was a show of force against the top-10 . the former mausoleum known as IU's Memorial Stadium is a combination of delirium and disbelief .

title: WWE Raw takeaways: Are Ripley and Sky WWE's new odd couple? Can Vaquer keep ascending?
content: the first Raw after Wrestlepalooza left the landmark event firmly in the rearview mirror . attention turned to building the card for crown jewel in Perth, Australia, on Oct. 11 . newly minted women's world champion Stephanie Vaquer delivered a heartfelt promo after it was announced she would square off with the winner of this Friday's triple-threat match .

title: October or bust? Inside Juan Soto's roller-coaster first season as a Met
content: the Mets defeated the Cubs 9-7 in their final homestand of the 2025 season . it was the final wild-card playoff spot in the national league . they lost two of three to the San Diego Padres , then lost control of their destiny .

title: Wrestlepalooza replay: Check out all the action
content: Content extraction failed.

title: What makes Barcelona's Ballon d'Or winners Bonmati and Lopez so special?
content: the ballon d'Or is one of the most prestigious individual awards in football, given to the best men's and women's player of the last year . the award was won by winger Vicky López ahead of real madrid's Linda Caicedo and Chelsea's Wieke Kaptein .

title: MLB playoff pressure rankings: Which World Series contenders must win now -- or else?
content: the answer is a little different for every team, and the force of that pressure changes with each passing season . the more success a team has without winning it all, the more the pressure builds up . only the Dodgers faithful are in a state of pure release -- because it won just last year .

title: Karnataka High Court rejects X Corp’s petition challenging take down orders
content: The Bench presided over by Justice M. Nagaprasanna maintained that social media needs to be regulated, especially in the cases of offences against women

title: Centre clarifies children aged below six not eligible for foster care placement
content: In an office memorandum issued last week, the Central Adoption Resource Authority (CARA) pointed to Rule 23(3) of the Juvenile Justice Rules and point 4(1) of the Model Foster Care Guidelines, which states that only children aged six years and above are eligible for placement in foster care, under circumstances defined in Rule 44 of the Act

title: Calcutta High Court directs West Bengal Government to engage RG Kar protest face Aniket Mahato at same hospital as senior resident
content: “Holding that the decision of the State to deploy Mahato at Raiganj Medical College and Hospital in Uttar Dinajpur district violates the principle of reasonableness,” Justice Biswajit Basu said

title: When will you provide evidence to CID: Rahul to CEC on Aland vote 'fraud'
content: Rahul Gandhi referred to media reports that the Election Commission of India has rolled out a new 'e-sign' feature that requires Aadhar-based verification for addition or deletion of votes.

title: Government needs to support farmers as crop prices determined by global factors: Gadkari
content: “We are facing problems of poverty and unemployment in rural and tribal India because farmers are not getting good prices in the global economy,” Nitin Gadkari said

title: Lingayats or Veerashaiva-Lingayats or Hindus? In Karnataka, a politically-charged conflict over religion and caste
content: Why has the demand for a separate religion for Veerashaiva-Lingayats come up now? What is the confusion around nomenclature?

title: Kannur Corporation in Kerala launches water Budget
content: The water Budget is designed to assess water availability and utilisation across the Corporation’s limits

title: My brother, my mentor, Assam’s rockstar: Zubeen Da
content: In this personal tribute, Assamese singer-songwriter Rahul Rajkhowa remembers Zubeen Garg who gave a state its soundtrack and a generation its courage

title: Virajpet, Kushalnagar and Hudikeri hospitals to be upgraded: Karnataka Health Minister
content: A 400-bed hospital had been proposed for Virajpet, but a 250-bed facility is currently under construction, along with residential quarters for doctors and nurses

title: Congress CWC meet: PM Modi’s ‘huglomacy’ has left India diplomatically isolated; vote ‘chori’ another trick from BJP toolkit
content: “The conspiracy of Special Intensive Revision (SIR) is the greatest threat to democracy, process designed to rob marginalised communities of their Right to Vote,” the resolution read

title: Relux Electric and Tamil Nadu Green Energy Corporation to set up 500 EV charging stations across State
content: Relux Electric and TNGECL will conduct a feasibility study to identify suitable government-owned lands across Tamil Nadu to set up the charging stations

title: Noted Kannada novelist S. L. Bhyrappa passes away
content: He was recipient of Padma Bhushan, Padma Shri, Saraswati Samman, Sahitya Akademi Awards, among others

title: KPCC ‘settles’ ₹60-lakh loan liability of former Wayanad DCC treasurer N.M. Vijayan
content: Family members of Vijayan had earlier threatened to go on hunger strike if the loan liability was not cleared, claiming that he had incurred them to help the party. It was alleged that even the land documents of their house had been pledged to the bank

title: Vanniyar Sangam to protest across T.N. demanding 10.5% internal reservation within MBC quota
content: S. Ramadoss said the real face of those who were “claiming to be the PMK” had been exposed after their expulsion from the party

title: Yuva Dasara kicks off with Arjun Janya’s concert in Mysuru
content: To ease congestion, the district administration had shifted the event from the city centre to the outskirts in 2024, a move continued this year as well

title: Pakistan should focus on economy instead of harbouring terrorists and bombing its own people: India at UNHRC
content: Referring to Pakistan-occupied Kashmir, Kshitij Tyagi, Counsellor at India’s Permanent Mission in Geneva asked Pakistan to vacate Indian territory “under their illegal occupation”

title: Supreme Court to urgently hear if school ground can play host to Ramlila celebrations
content: Supreme Court to hear challenge on Ramlila celebrations at a school ground in Uttar Pradesh, questioning use of secular spaces for religious events

title: Ambani’s Reliance Consumer Products Limited to set up integrated manufacturing facility in Tamil Nadu
content: Tamil Nadu’s Industries Minister T.R.B Rajaa, in a post on X, said that the facility will come up at Sipcot Allikulam Industrial Park in Thoothukudi.

title: Madras High Court orders CBI probe into T.N. BSP leader Armstrong’s murder
content: Justice P. Velmurugan passes the order while allowing a petition filed by the brother of the deceased complaining about the investigation conducted by Greater Chennai City Police

title: Supreme Court to hear matter on statutory age of consent for adolescents on November 12
content: The Centre has defended the statutory age of consent of 18 years, saying the decision was a "deliberate, well-considered, and coherent" policy choice

title: Historian Romila Thapar slams UGC’s curriculum draft
content: LOCF risks diluting higher education quality; Indian Knowledge System cannot be confined to one religion, asserts the noted historian

title: Violent protests break out at BJP office in Ladakh’s Leh amid shutdown seeking Statehood
content: The protest was held in support of the demand to advance the proposed talks with the Centre on extension of Sixth Schedule as well as Statehood to Ladakh

title: September rains hit harder, farmers to get aid before Diwali: Maharashtra Agriculture Minister
content: Maharashtra Minister Gulabrao Patil on Tuesday (September 23) said the State Government should declare a "wet drought" in Jalgaon district and parts of Marathwada

title: SNDP says NSS detente with Kerala govt on Sabarimala will benefit LDF in elections
content: Vellappally Natesan says he concurs with NSS general secretary G. Sukumaran Nair’s ‘informed stance’ that neither Congress nor BJP had helped resolve the ‘emotive issue’ of preserving temple traditions in the wake of 2018 Supreme Court order allowing entry of women of all ages into the temple

title: Prime accused in Assam Rifles’ convoy ambush in Manipur arrested, arms recovered
content: At the spot examination, the prime accused admitted that he is a bailed-out member of the banned People’s Liberation Army (PLA).

title: NIA books designated terrorist Pannun over his call to stop PM Modi from hoisting flag on August 15
content: Pannun allegedly attempted to instigate Sikh soldiers to stop PM Modi from hoisting the national flag at Red Fort, for which he offered a ₹11-crore reward

title: Zubeen Garg death: Assam prohibits North East India Festival organiser Shyamkanu Mahanta from holding any event in State
content: Garg’s sudden demise sent shockwaves across Assam, with many demanding an independent inquiry into the matter

title: Won't order listing of case on same day unless someone to be hanged: Supreme Court Judge Surya Kant
content: Justice Kant's remarks came when an advocate, Shobha Gupta, mentioned that a residential house in Rajasthan will be auctioned today and hence be listed today itself

title: 'Forcing world to buy American oil': Russia reacts to Trump's 'paper tiger' jibe

title: 2030 Commonwealth Games: India presents proposal to host Games in Ahmedabad
content: The Indian team was led by Gujarat's Minister of Sports, Harsh Sanghavi, and the Indian Olympic Association (IOA) president, P.T. Usha

title: Telangana HC suspends single judge order in Group-I exam; posts matter  to October 15 for detailed hearing
content: After hearing contentions of the counsels of both the sides, the bench directed all of them to file written submissions by October 10

title: Kerala Devaswom Minister hails ‘constructive’ role of NSS, rejects BJP-RSS suggestion on Vavar at Sabarimala
content: V.N. Vasavan welcomes the community organisation’s support for recent Global Ayyappa Sangamam organised by TDB

title: Madras High Court judge recuses from hearing case filed by Minister Duraimurugan
content: Justice M. Dhandapani says, he had appeared for the Minister during his stint as a lawyer and therefore, does not want to hear the present case

title: School bus rams wall in Kerala, 20 students injured
content: Driver tells police that the vehicle was going down an incline when it experienced mechanical failure and rammed the compound wall of a house

title: Nowadays, a few States want to dilute Governor’s authority: Dharmendra Pradhan
content: Further, the Union Education Minister said, “Opposition against National Education Policy is political”

title: Actor Sonu Sood appears before ED in 1xBet betting app linked money laundering case
content: The federal probe agency has questioned former cricketers Suresh Raina, Shikhar Dhawan, Robin Uthappa and Yuvraj Singh over the last few weeks as part of the 1xBet betting app case probe

title: What are personality rights and how have courts shielded Indian celebrities
content: Experts told The Hindu that legislative intervention is urgently needed to end reliance on piecemeal judicial precedents in enforcing personality rights

title: U.S. firm HCA Healthcare opens its first GCC in Hyderabad
content: Minister Sridhar Babu inaugurates the centre, which has its office in more than 4 lakh sq ft facility, entail $75 million in investment and employ 3,000 people by 2026

title: Uppada fishermen’s issues to be addressed by government committee: Pawan Kalyan
content: A special committee will be constituted to focus on resolving immediate issues, improving livelihoods, and developing infrastructure in coastal villages

title: CM Fadnavis, deputies to visit flood-hit Marathwada; Ajit Pawar assures Govt help to rain-hit farmers in Maharashtra
content: Maharashtra Congress spokesperson, Sachin Sawant, targeted the Government, saying it has announced ₹2,215 crore in assistance to 31.64 lakh farmers affected by heavy rainfall.

title: Smuggling of luxury cars from Bhutan into Kerala likely to face wider probe by Central agencies
content: Customs authorities are set to share details of violations with relevant agencies – ED, NIA, MVD, and GST – paving the way for a multi-agency, nationwide investigation as these vehicles are believed to have been sold in more States

title: H-1B visa | The Hindu’s coverage on U.S. work immigration visa fee hike and its impact
content: Reports, analysis, explainers, videos, podcasts and more on America’s H-1B visa amid the new regulations imposed by the Trump administration

title: Road crash in J&K’s Poonch leaves five Army personnel injured
content: The Army personnel suffered minor injuries in the accident and were shifted to Sub-district hospital Mendhar

title: 7-year-old girl dies while undergoing treatment in Rachakonda, parents allege negligence
content: She was taken to a local practitioner who holds a Bachelor of Homeopathic Medicine and Surgery (BHMS) degree and practices homeopathy, according to an officer

title: External Affairs Minister Jaishankar calls for stronger Global South solidarity, collective push for United Nations reform
content: Mr. Jaishankar made the remarks at a high-level meeting of Like-Minded Global South countries in New York on September 24

title: SIR disruptive, may trigger mass disenfranchisement, vote theft, alleges CPI(ML) General Secretary
content: Speaking on Prashant Kishor’s Jan Suraaj Party, Dipankar Bhattacharya said that “a new party launched with so much money and media power is rare. Next to the BJP, it may be the strongest in terms of resources”

title: KSRTC bus collides with truck in Kerala capital, 12 injured
content: Following the collision, both drivers were trapped inside their vehicles for about half an hour. A Fire and Rescue Services team rescued them

title: 'Vote chori', Trump's tariffs to figure in CWC meeting in Patna: Bihar Congress Chief Rajesh Kumar
content: The State party chief bristled at the BJP-led NDA’s charge that the Congree Working Committee meeting “has always been held in Delhi, but now scheduled in the Bihar capital as a tactic”

title: Kolkata rains: City gradually returning to normalcy after rain fury, several areas remain waterlogged
content: The Met department has ruled out heavy rain in the city during the next 24 hours, though it forecast mostly cloudy skies with light to moderate showers

title: India close partner of U.S., but Trump imposed additional tariff for purchasing Russian oil: Rubio
content: The U.S. Secretary of State was responding to a question that Donald Trump has "repeatedly threatened" to take action against Vladimir Putin but backed off those threats

title: Lessons from the history of rebellions in AIADMK and DMK in Tamil Nadu
content: With discomfort in the AIADMK showing no signs of subsiding, after former School Education Minister and veteran leader K.A. Sengottaiyan was divested of party posts following his call for the return of estranged leaders, it is a timely moment to revisit some of the most significant uprisings within Tamil Nadu’s two major Dravidian parties

title: How an auto driver helped bust child trafficking ring in Tamil Nadu 16 years ago
content: The first tip-off came from an alert auto driver in Tiruchi who led the police to unravel a gang involved in abduction and illegal adoption of babies

title: IPR Gandhinagar team proposes roadmap for India’s fusion power plans
content: Controlled fusion can only happen in extreme conditions, the kinds that exist inside stars. There are currently two popular ways to achieve this: inertial confinement and magnetic confinement. India is already invested in the magnetic confinement technique as a member of the ITER project, which is building a reactor in France

title: Closed-door hearing on Panvel ward delimitation triggers complaint
content: Citizens, organisations allege denial of participation in process; formal complaint filed with Election Commission demanding open and transparent hearing.

title: No ban on meat, egg sale in Bhopal during Navratri, officials deny news reports
content: Speaking to The Hindu, Bhopal Collector Kaushalendra Vikram Singh said, “No such order has been issued by the district administration placing a blanket ban like this.”

content: Chief Minister Pushkar Singh Dhami reiterated that those involved in exam malpractices will not be spared under any circumstances.
